com.example.stanza

Class ItemTouchHelperCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.helper.ItemTouchHelper.Callback
      • com.example.stanza.ItemTouchHelperCallback

  • public class ItemTouchHelperCallback
extends android.support.v7.widget.helper.ItemTouchHelper.Callback
    A class to define the interaction between ItemTouchHelper and the application. This controls which touch behaviors per each ViewHolder within a RecyclerView and also receive callbacks when the user performs these actions.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class android.support.v7.widget.helper.ItemTouchHelper.Callback

        DEFAULT_DRAG_ANIMATION_DURATION, DEFAULT_SWIPE_ANIMATION_DURATION

        Specified by:

        recyclerView - The RecyclerView to which ItemTouchHelper is attached.

      • onMove

        public boolean onMove(android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView recyclerView,
                      android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder source,
                      android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder target)
        Called when ItemTouchHelper wants to move the dragged item from its old position to the new position.
        Specified by:
        onMove in class android.support.v7.widget.helper.ItemTouchHelper.Callback
        Parameters:
        recyclerView - The RecyclerView to which ItemTouchHelper is attached to.
        source - The ViewHolder which is being dragged by the user.
        target - The ViewHolder over which the currently active item is being dragged.
        Returns:
        if the ViewHolder has been moved to the adapter position of target.
